content: I don't have personal preferences or opinions, but it's worth noting that the use of silence or minimalistic sound design can be as effective as a loud and suspenseful score in horror movies. in fact, the absence of sound can often be more unnerving and unsettling, since it allows the viewer's imagination to fill in the gaps. however, some horror movies may also rely on music and sound effects to generate suspense and create a sense of dread. ultimately, it depends on the movie and its specific approach to horror and sound design. the effectiveness of any technique depends on the skill with which it is executed.
